1.content: Firstly, are you male or female.
1.title: The important questions

11.content:
You have a strange dream. You are standing on a rather large glass platform. You look down, and to your astonishment, see a mural of snow white under your feet, sorrounded by her seven dwarves, and various other woodland animals sorrounding her. Suddenly you could hear a voice, not far away, but not distant, but not close either, it didn't seem to come from anywhere. Neither did it sound like anything. You could hear it, but it didn't sound like anything. You could make out words...

So much to do...
So little time...

Take your time...
Don't be afraid...

The door is still shut...

Now step forward,
can you do it?

You could see the middle of the platform light up.
You wonder wether to obey, but hey, it's just a dream, what could possibly go wrong, so you lurch forward

Power sleeps within you...
If you give it form...

Right when it said that, three pedestals suddenly sprung up from the ground, then on each one, an object appeared. On the one in front of you, a red kite shield with a... mickey mouse? emblem etched on it. How strange, you never knew the mickey mouse cartoons to be that millitant. On the pedestal to the right of you, a longsword appeared. On the last pedestal to the left of you, a green rod with a blue mickey mouse logo resting on top of it.

It will give you strength.
Choose well.

(this will not determine any weapons you wield)
11.title: the choice of destiny

111.content:
You boldly walk to the sword, a determined look on your face, and you grip it by the hilt. As your hand wrapped around it, you could feel the coldness of the metal, but also you feel power flow through you as a new strength grips you, suddenly, you feel braver, stronger, and more determined as if this sword was your destiny.

The power of the warrior.
Invincible courage.
A sword of terrible destruction.
This is the path you chose

Suddenly, you could hear glass crack. You look down to see a long, jagged cut go through the snow white mural, then suddenly, it shatters and you go tumbling into the dark depths beneath...

Then suddenly you wake up from this weird dream...

Where do you live
111.title: The power of the warrior

1111.content:
Standing in a large field, you wonder what's going on.

In your hand was a (Type of Sword), and you give it a swing; a tree nearby fell due to an blade of wind which came from the sword.

Suddenly, a group of shadow-like creatures (Heartless) appeared before you and attack. You deside that you must fight back and so begins your first battle.

(Choose your weapon)
1111.title: The Field

11111.content:
The weapon you had in your hands was a Katana, which had a long sharp blade.

The strange creatures circled around you, about to attack at any second. You run over to one and swing, direct hit, the creature vanished in a puff of smoke.

Right away, the others jumped up in the air; you somehow jump high as well, as if you know how to fight, and you do a spin attack.

Your blade cut each one down, but more appeared after each one, it seemed endless.

But you continue to fight, not wanting to lose against the black creatures, cutting down wave after wave.

Even though you were more powerful, you were tired, you couldn't do this forever.

Suddenly, someone appeared and began to fight the creatures as well; who is it?
11111.title: Endless Waves

111111.content: weird kid holding a giant key this dream get's weirder and weirder you think?
111111.title: Sora

1111112.content:
You decide to team up with him so this will end quick. The two of you begin fighting the creatures until they retreat, the boy then go to where ou are and introduce himself.
"Hi, I'm Sora"
"I'm (Your name)"
"So what are you doing in the middle of nowhere"
"I don't know, I just wake up here"
"Mmm, well I'm gonna meet with some friends, wanna come?"
1111112.title: Team up

11111121.content:
You decide to follow Sora. You follow Sora until he sees a gray house in ruins. Sora looked shocked at how the gray house was in ruins.

"Oh no! The house is ruined. My only chance of returning to my world is gone..." wept Sora.

"Don't worry Sora. We'll find another way of returning into your world." You say.

Sora tried to stop himself from crying and after Sora stop crying he said, "At least I got company."

"I'll never leave your company," you exclaim.

"There may still be hope," Sora exclaims, "We could either investigate the ruins of the house or we could explore this world."
11111121.title: The Surprising Surprise of Surprises

choices: In Wonderland falling down a hole
111111212.content:
"Let's go explore a bit." you say.

"OK! Maybe we can find our way back home." Sora exclaims.

You and Sora then headed north with you looking out for any interesting scenery that might take you and Sora back to your own world while Sora lead the way. As you two walked, Sora noticed that his Keyblade was beginning to glow a light yellow colour, and in an instant you both stop to see what is happening to the Keyblade.

"Something's happening to my Keyblade and it's starting to get a bit warmer." mentioned Sora as he drops the Keyblade as he can't handle holding the Keyblade anymore.

You both stop, and as the Keyblade starts getting brighter you both cover your eyes as the light of the keyblade is just too bright to look at. A moment later you both pass out.

Where do you both wake up?
111111212.title: A New Adventure

1111112121.content:
When you regain consciousness you and Sora find yourself falling down a hole... quite a peculiar hole in fact. Fortunately you've watched Disney's version of "Alice in Wonderland" and its 2010 sequel about 3 times. Unfortunately the both of you weren't floating down like Disney's movie, instead the both of you were falling like the sequel. As you and Sora were falling down at a great pace, you could see lots of weird things that were studded. Mirrors, stoves, pianos, clocks and other everyday appliances are studded onto the wall. Your speed gradually gets slower and as you and Sora touch the ground it seems like you were floating down.You got to your feet and looked around the room. You look around and see that you're in a round room with red and pink checker tiled floor and wallpaper, and four couches of different colours surrounding you and Sora.

"Oh my fur and whiskers! I'm late, I'm late, I'm late!" screamed a white rabbit who was running towards a hallway leading to another room, looking at his unusually large watch, wearing a red jacket.

'Oh dear, oh dear, oh dear! I'm here, I should be there!" The rabbit said again not noticing you or Sora, "I'm late, I'm late, I'm late! The queen, she'll have my head for sure!"

You were still holding your Katana and Sora still had his Keyblade in his hand but you and Sora wondered.

What was he late for?
1111112121.title: Down the Rabbit Hole

11111121211.content:
Hey, wait!" You called to him, pacing after him leaving Sora to follow you.

The flustered rabbit swung open a door. He scurried through the door, screaming, "I'm late! I'm late!"

His voice echoed, as he ran further and further away. You couldn't see the rabbit anymore, and you assumed he wasn't very far, so you decided to keep trailing after him.

You peeked into the door the strange rattled rabbit had left open behind him-- wait, there were two larger doors overlapping a smaller door. Three doors for one entrance? What's the point? You thought for a moment, as you started twisting the door nobs in confusion. You regained your focus, and you and Sora entered the room.

You and Sora stepped into a perfectly rectangular room. It had a small round table in the middle of it and fold-able bed on the right, with doors of many diverse sizes that surrounded the perimeter. The door sizes were very odd. Some were smaller than others, wider, narrower, larger, and all sorts of different sizes. You turned the nob of a door to the left that was closest to you, and pushed and pulled, but it wouldn't budge. You tried the same with many other doors, but not a single door would open.

You look around the room and kick the bed causing it to reveal a secret passage that was far too small for you to enter.

Where's that really tiny yellow door, You think to yourself when you see Sora looking at a small yellow door that was slightly open. You instantly recognize the golden doorknob on the yellow door as the talking doorknob that greeted Alice in the movie. You quickly rush over to the yellow door where Sora is.

"How did he get so small?" he asks himself as he examines the door not noticing the face on the doorknob.

"No, you're simply too big." replied the doorknob.

"It talks!" Sora screamed.

"Must you be so loud? You woke me up. I need a bit more sleep." replied the doorknob who was about to snooze off when Sora stopped him from doing so.

"Wait, what do we have to do to grow small?" asked Sora.

"Why don't you try the bottle... over there?" the doorknob stated while gesturing towards the table and to your surprise, two bottles along with 2 cups suddenly appeared on the table. Both of the bottles had labels saying Drink Me! but the colour of the labeling were different. You don't know if you should try the blue one or the orange one.
11111121211.title: "It talks!"

choices: Sora grows and hit'shis head on the cealing(O-Bottle = twice his normal hight)
You two shrink and get on with the story (slow growth for Sora)
111111212111.content:
Your a bit worried of what the bottles will do. On one hand, one of them will shrink you and Sora to fit through the door. But on the other, one may have disastrous results.

"Let's drink the Blue bottle" said Sora.

"Wait" you said. "I think you should test it out first, I mean we don't even know if one really will shrink us."

"I can assure you that one of them can shrink you, now hurry up. I need to sleep" said the, annoyed, doorknob.

"It's ok, I'll drink it first" said Sora. He then poured half into each cup, and drank his.

"I don't think anything happened" you said to Sora.

"Both bottles will do something, but only one will shrink you" said the Doorknob. Sora desided to drink the other cup, in case only the full bottle will take affect.

"I guess it's a dud" you said. "So the orange one must shrink us."


What happens now that Sora drank the Blue bottle?
111111212111.title: Try the Blue One

111111212112.content:
You decide to try the orange bottle on the table. After you poured the contents of the orange bottle into the two cups evenly, you and Sora grab a cup and gulp down the contents of the drink.

Lightheadedness strikes you for a second, suddenly everything around you is gigantic.... actually you and Sora shrunk to the size of the bottle.

Disorientated you looked around the room, the once small table now looks like a tower now, A door that was no bigger than your hand is over 4 times your size now and the bottles that were on the table were now the exact same size as you are now.

"Wha...What?!" you stammered while looking around.

Even through you were the size of an large insect, at least you can proceed outside the room and besides; Sora is also shrunk and everything that is attached to you is now shrunk with you.

Suddenly a swarm of Heartless that is the exact same height as you appear and you decide to fight them. They were easy to kill but you realize that with the Heartless now in Wonderland, you'll never know how Wonderland has changed with these creatures lurking about...
111111212112.title: Growing Small

choices: Sora goes up and defends Alice
1111112121121.content:
You both go through the hidden doorway.

You and Sora both magically outside the Queen's Castle where a court session is about the start. There were a flight of stairs to the left and the right which in the middle stood the Queen on the top and Alice on the bottom of the platforms. Several playing card soldiers were guarding the area in case someone disrupted it. It was quite neat indeed as the grass has been finely chopped to a appropriate level. As you observe some more you see the white rabbit now running on top of the left flight of chairs, he was now holding a trumpet.When he reached the top he played a short royal tune then he declared, "Court is now in session!".

"I'm on trial? But why?" asked Alice.

"Her majesty, the Queen of Hearts, presiding!" exclaimed the white rabbit. The queen stood up, looked at Alice, and then started speaking.

"This girl is the culprit. There's no doubt about it." The queen explained, "And the reason is... because I say so, that's why!"

"That is so unfair!" complained Alice.

"Well, have you anything to say in your defence?" asked the queen.

"Of course!" replied Alice, "I've done absolutely nothing wrong. You may be queen, but I'm afraid that doesn't you the right to be so... so mean!"

"Silence!" yelled the queen.

Meanwhile while you were watching the court session, Sora started talking to you,

"Hey, [your name], we should help her out."

Yeah, but the..." you thought for a second before continuing, "We're outsiders, so wouldn't that be mu-meddling? Something bad could happen to us."

Sora just stared at Alice...
1111112121121.title: Law and Order

11111121211211.content:
The queen finished her court session, "The court finds the defendant, guilty as charged! For the crimes of assault and attempted theft of my heart... OFF WITH HER HEAD!!!!!". Several of the Playing Card soldiers were surrounding Alice.

Sora was preparing to defend Alice. You tried to warned him not to mess things up by talking to him about the consequences of messing things up.

"No! No! Oh, please!" Alice pleaded interrupting your talking.

"Hold it right there!" Sora interrupted running towards Alice while knocking over the Playing Card soldiers.

"Who are you?" asked the queen, "How dare you interfere with my court?"

"Excuse me. But we know who the real culprit is!" explained Sora, "Anyway, she's not the one you're looking for."

OMG! He even included in his mess? you think.

"That's nonsense. Have you any proof?" the queen asked while Alice was being put in a big yellow cage.

"Uh..." stuttered Sora.

"Bring me evidence of Alice's innocence! Fail, and it's off with all of your heads! Gather as much or little evidence as you please. Report back here once you're ready." said the queen.

Where to look first?
11111121211211.title: Interfering the Queen's Court

111111212112112.content:
Since you don't want to look around the Queen's Castle you decide to go away from the castle. You and Sora exit through the left into a forest.

**********

The both of you enter the forest. The forest seemed really large as the grass was three times bigger than you and there were lotus trees? Anyway before you can think anymore suddenly a purple head that was smiling suddenly started appearing and disappearing until the remaining of it's body started appearing which then the body started putting back its head in. It was the Cheshire cat that you've seen in the movies.

"Who are you?" asked Sora.

"Who, indeed?" the Cheshire Cat commented, "Poor Alice. Soon to lose her head, and she's not guilty of a thing."

"Hey, if you know who the culprit is, tell us!" you shouted.

"The Cheshire Cat has all the answers... but doesn't always tell. The answer, the culprit, the cat all lie in darkness." The Cheshire Cat started fading away slowly.

"Wait!" shouted Sora.

"They've already left the forest. I won't tell which exit. There are four pieces of evidence in all. Three are a cinch to find. The fourth is tricky. Big reward if you find them all." The Cheshire cat was barely visible.

"Should we trust him?" you ask to Sora.

Instead of Sora saying anything, the Cheshire Cat instead replied his last sentences before he completed vanished, "To trust, or not to trust? I'll trust you'll de..."

Immediately after the Cheshire Cat faded away you see a group of soldier heartless patrolling the forest. You and Sora go down in battle and start getting into battling and you start destroying them all. After you and Sora defeat the heartless you...
111111212112112.title: The Cheshire Cat

1111112121121121.content:
As you are about to follow Sora again your eyes stop at a pretty yellow flower that stands out in the forest. You ignore that flower and get going to follow Sora in finding evidence. As you search the ground for evidence you accidentally stumble upon some claw marks which look strangely unnatural. Uncomfortable with the claw marks you tap Sora on the shoulder and tell him about the claw marks you have just found.

"We better get these claw marks as part of our evidence." said Sora who was grabbing a red box.

Now since you've got one piece of evidence, maybe the Queen of hearts would believe that Alice is innocent.
1111112121121121.title: Claw Marks

11111121211211211.content:
"Yep!" you exclaim, "This is enough evidence to prove Alice is guilty!"

"Are you sure?" Sora asked, "I don't think one is enough for a crazy queen."

"Relax Sora," you reassured with a friendly grin, "What can go wrong?"

"Okay," Sora grinned, "I'm still not too sure though."

You and Sora stopped looking for evidence and you decide to turn around and walk back to where the Queen's courtroom is. You can still see that look of uncertainty on Sora's face as the both of you leave the forest.

You reach and walk in the entrance to the Queen's courtroom and you see that not much has happened since you left the courtroom a couple of moments ago. The soldier cards are still guarding Alice, the queen is still waiting in the front impatiently and the mood of the situation is still dull. However, once the queen saw you, she quickly stood up out of her chair to speak.

"Are you ready to present evidence before your queen?" the queen asked in a demanding voice.

"Yes!" you confidently reply.

"Very well! One of you step up to the podium." She ordered.

You walk towards the podium while Sora watches from a few steps away. As soon as you are in position, she begins the trial.

"Now, show me what you have found." The queen demanded.

"Sora!" you called, "Do you still have that red box?"

"Yeah! Here you go!" grinned Sora as he presented the evidence to the queen.

"Cards! Bring forth my evidence!" The queen ordered as one of the cards brought up their own identical red box and handed it over to the queen. The Queen shuffled the boxes up and gave them back to one of the cards before getting placed on the ground.

"Hmm, checking the both of them will only be a waste of time." The Queen commented, "All right then. Choose the box you wish to present. I'll decide who's guilty based on that evidence."

"What?" You exclaimed, "After all the trouble of collecting it."

"You dare object? Then you will lose your head!" The Queen threatened.

"We only did collect one piece anyways so it wasn't that hard, huh?"

"You're not helping Sora!" you yelled with rage.

"Now choose! One box only!"

You have a 50-50 chance on getting this wrong.
11111121211211211.title: Fifty-Fifty

11111121211211212.content:
You realize you need more evidence and you and Sora need to start looking now!

You look around for more evidence lying around. You were failing. Before you can think anymore Sora interrupts you and says, "Maybe we can climb these lotuses and mushrooms to find more evidence."

"Yeah. You're probably right." you replied.

So you start to look around the strange forest for anything to climb when you see two huge yellow planted mushrooms that were easily reachable for you to climb. You grab on to the top of the mushrooms and you climb the mushrooms along with Sora until the both of you reach the top. Once you reach the top you see some kind of black portal that seems to lead somewhere else. Without hesitation you and Sora both go in the strange looking black hole and you both emerge down a hole into the room where you both have shrunk before onto the top of the furnace. Although you have seemed to be in the same room you smell a stench that you don't recognize but one that makes you feel uncomfortable. You shudder as your response to the smell.

"I have a feeling that the Heartless have left this room not long ago." Sora suggested.

"Maybe we can use that as evidence?" you remarked.

"Good idea!" replied Sora. He grabbed another red box out of his pocket that was identical to the previous one he took out beforehand.

You've got two out of four possible clues that you could show to the queen. The queen of hearts would probably believe the both of you if you handed in both clues in?
11111121211211212.title: Stench

111111212112112122.content:
You figure that you need to keep searching for more evidence.

You and Sora go through the hidden passage again in the room to go back to the outskirts of the Queen's castle. As you arrive there, you are greeted by a red heart soldier holding a red lance tipped with a red heart. They look very similar to the playing cards you've seen people used.

"Are you ready to present your evidence before the queen?" asks the soldier.

"Not really," you reply.

"You'd better bring your evidence soon," said the soldier resuming his duties. You and Sora walk away from the castle and are immediately back into the lotus forest again. You and Sora begin to search the damp dirt floor for any evidence or clues. In the first few minutes of your search, you find nothing out of the ordinary. All you see is dirt and soil. It's like no strange activity has even happened on the ground. Instead of giving up, you go back into searching and look more closely. After a few minutes of your very careful searching, you manage to find a couple of very small three toed footprints imprinted on some wet dirt. You tap Sora on the shoulder to tell him what you have found. Sora turns around and talks to you.

"Found anything yet?" asks Sora.

"I found a footprint," you reply.

"Good searching," Sora says as he grabs yet another small red box out of his pocket and puts the footprint in the red box. You're now starting to get a bit confused at the many red boxes that Sora puts in his pocket and how he is 'gathering' the evidence. It's probably a magic box, you think. You and Sora have found three pieces of evidence. The fourth piece will prove to be difficult as it seems you've searched almost everywhere.

What do you do next?
111111212112112122.title: Footprints

11111121211212.content:
You can't help but think about Sora more than the court case that is going terribly against Alice.

"The court finds the defendant, guilty as charged," the queen explained For the crimes of assault and attempted theft of my heart... OFF WITH HER HEAD!!!!!"

You can clearly tell that Sora is preparing to run towards the court and defend Alice despite warning him about the consequences. Sora tries to get up but you tightly restrain him with your arms to stop him from causing problems to get worse in the court.

"No! No! Oh, please!" Alice pleaded.

"SILENCE!" the queen ordered, "Seize her at once!"

The playing card soldiers quickly marched towards Alice circling her so she can't escape. Two of the soldiers then grabbed Alice by the arms and legs and started carrying her towards the castle with the rest of the soldier following them. The Queen looked quite proud of herself finally capturing Alice to get her head off. Soon, she will witness the beheading of Alice. The queen returned to her castle a few minutes later. You quickly let go off Sora only to be yelled at.

"What did you restrain me for, idiot?" screamed Sora; "I would've saved her if it wasn't for you!"

"If I'd let you go up and interrupt this stupid court, then you've would've been killed as well," you replied.

"I'd rather risk my life for that girl than let her die without trying!" Sora exclaimed, "Now I'm going to have to rescue her whenever you like it or not!"

"But it's too dangerous!" you plead but it's too late; Sora has already started walking.

As Sora walks towards the castle, you feel guilt hit you like a stack of bricks. Maybe you should go with Sora and say sorry to him on the way but that might get you caught in more trouble. You can also leave Sora and go a different way but you don't know how to get out of here.
11111121211212.title: Guility

1113.content:
You wake with a start bolting upright in your bed breathing hard as you do drenched in sweat. The whole thing seems strange, why would such an odd dream affect you in such a way? Dreams never bothered you that much before...

You dismiss it as nerves, today is going to be a big day after all, it is only natural you'd be nervous.

Rolling out of bed you stretch looking out at the town you call home, a small farming community that appears similar the a modernized version of a Western. It might not be much compaired to the cities and only be visited by people who come the visit the old fort outside of town, but it is your home and you know it always will be. Realizing you are going to need clothes to go about your day you quickly pick out your favorite t-shirt and jeans from a pile of clothes next to your bed and hurry to the bathroom zipping in just before your younger sister can get there blowing a rasberry at her as you slam and lock the door.

She pounds on the door angrily shouting a string of words you know she didn't learn here and agravate her more by turning on the shower and pretending not to hear her as you sing songs in a deep bass enhanced by the four walls of the shower. About the time your sister quits shouting you finish up and dress yourself brushing back you hair so it won't get in your eyes later today.

You pause before exiting the bathroom to glance at yourself in the mirror. You don't seem any diffrent from before, still a man in his late teens, finally finished growing into his body, body toned and tanned from relentless farmwork his whole life, with a few scars to show for it. A bit of a beard growing in and well cared fore shoulder length brown hair that everyone seemed to think makes you look like a hippie for some reason. But that doesn't to you matter because at the end of the day you know you are going to be...
1113.title: Small Town USA

choices: A group of white rubbery creatures
11132.content:
For whatever reason, a fighting competition has decided to host itself near your town with the prize being a hundred thousand dollars. You’re certainly the best fighter at your town so why not try your hand for the money.

You brush past your sister ruffling her hair a bit which she ignores rushing into the bathroom. Your parents have already headed out to the fields and farm to work leaving you only a bowl of cereal and a note wishing you luck in your venture. You eat little unable to contain your excitement and a small bit of dread before tossing on you duster and heading out for the truck.

It starts with a cough before finally building to a roar. It takes you only a few hours to get to the arena that has been constructed on the outskirts of the city. You can see a large crowd has already built and fighting furiously to get inside to see the most interesting thing to happen in the area in decades. You are relieved that you are allowed to take a side entrance instead of battling the flood.

Inside you can see nearly a hundred people gathered around talking to each other in excited voices. Almost all of them are muscular and wearing some sort of fighting uniform, almost like something out of a cartoon. But in one corner is a woman who looks drastically different, she is pale shrouded in long black robes with a headpiece that made it look like she had two large black horns.

She looked like a light weight but seemed extremely dangerous all the same. You sign in quickly hoping that you won’t have to fight this woman until later in the finals if ever. When the board goes up you see that you will be in the fifth match against someone named Maleficent. An interesting name, maybe someone is trying to over compensate for something.

It was not long until the opening ceremony began and you along with everyone else was paraded before the roaring crowd and you get your first glimpse at the towering gold trophy that will go to the winner of the competition. It looks beautiful, almost magical, as if there may be something more to it than simple metal.

Before you can admire it to much you are ushered backstage where the so the first fight may get underway. The first battle between a black belt karate master and a street thug ended predictably with the karate master winning and the next several fights proceed along the same lines with experience beating youth or rage. This makes you sweat a bit with you lacking a single day of real training and little going for you other than your toned rock hard body. Your fight is next.

You walk out to the field onto the arena floor covered with mats to try to prevent to bad and injury during the event. You feel your heart sink to see the woman in black almost seeming to float along next to you looking at you as if you a speck of dirt soon to be brushed aside.

Nevertheless, you enter the ring and bow to her saying, “Give it all you’ve got.”

“Foolish child,” the woman says scornfully, “You would not survive an instant.”

The starting gong sound and before you can move five black splotches appear on the ground from which crawl five strange creatures pitch black aside from their massive glowing eyes on their disportional heads. Things go silent as Maleficent simply says, “Dispose of him.”

The creatures waddle forward and slash at you with sharp claws aiming for your chest. You give ground from surprise before wading into the group stomping on one causing it to disperse into black mist and kick another causing it to similarly explode. One jumps at you claws extended, you grab it flinging it out of the ring before punching another in the face. The last creature sinks into the ground flowing past you and springing up behind you silent as a whisper. You only just duck the attack exploding your foe with an uppercut.

While surprised you are still fresh and mostly unharmed, “Is that the best you can do lady?”

“Not at all,” Maleficent laughed, “But why dirty my own hands with you child.”

There was a swirl of something black and a massive eight-foot tall horribly fat creature appear before you. You hardly have time to mutter, “Holy-” before the creature swats you with its thick arms knocking back ten feet and winding you. You stagger to you feet in time to see the creature charge you gut first, you barely manage to leap away as it charges past you. The beast pauses a few yards later to scratch it head in confusion.

You take advantage of its confusion to lead up and punch it as hard as you can in the face knocking it off its feet. While it’s down you yank off the creature’s small helmet and pound wildly at its head until it to burst vanishing into the darkness from which it came. You are beginning to feel winded, that thing hit you hard and seemed to cost this witch nothing.

You don’t bother taunting her for defeating her monster you run Maleficent intent on delivering a haymaker to her face. Before you can you are intercepted by…

1122.title: World that Never Was

11221.content:
In a fit of instinct, you draw a piece of yourself out. You and everyone around you are shocked to see an ebony black shield, devoid of markings of any kind, appears in your hands. You stare at it, mystified, as the others murmur in surprise amongst themselves.
Xemnas, himself, only seems to be watching in amusement, however.
One of the ones in the lower chairs speaks out, one you would later know as Demyx. "This is so cool. If he's this conscious already, we can put him to use now, right? Haha! Less work for me." He chuckles to himself in glee.
"Not necessarily..." Another replied, one you would recognize soon as Saix. "He could still be acting on instinct, so for now we wait and see."
"Aw, man... Such a bummer." Demyx moaned in disappointment.
"Enough!" Xemnas called, quelling the others. "He is now here, and we welcome him into our Organization, as number XV... Xehoni."
"Xi...on..." You say, just loud enough for everyone to hear. "...ere... s... Xi... on?" Your speech comes out faint, but your entire being screams at you to find her, to see her again.
At this, Xemnas takes a second to think.
"He must think he is connected to her." Saix suggested. "Perhaps, because she was the first to find him, he developed a connection with her."
"Then let her teach him, and observe his development. I want to see how he progresses." Xemnas declares.
"As you wish." Saix replied, bowing his head before disappearing in a cloud of darkness. The others quickly followed, all except for one... A young boy who looked about your age, someone you would later come to know as a close friend, regarding you with great interest. He remained only a few seconds longer before following the others. Seconds after, you were led away to your own personal room, the ebony black shield fading away.
11221.title: A Black shield Appears in your hands

choices: An uneventful day of training later
112211.content:
It took time to arrive at your room. At one point, you saw Xion and instinctively turned to her, however, you were pulled away. This caused you to struggle, but you were knocked unconscious and taken away before she even noticed you.
You awoke the next day to find the boy from yesterday standing meer inches from your bed. You slowly get up and look around to see a very bare room with an empty journal and pen atop a desk on one side of the room. That, and the bed you were on appeared to be the only furniture here.
"Your awake now? Good. Today you start learning what we do around here." The boy declared, causing you to jump and look at him in surprise.
"Who... Who are you?" You ask, actually speeking clearly now.
"My name is Roxas." The boy replied. "And if my hunch is right, you and I will be working a lot together for a few weeks. Now if you're ready, follow me." At this, he turned and stepped out of the room. You get off the bed and pause only long enough to pocket the journal before leaving. Something told you you'd need it.

Roxas led you through several hallways and twisting corridors to a room where several of the people you saw yesterday, as well as some you haven't met yet, were sitting around in groups talking to each other. They paused when you entered, but didn't pay you much mind before returning to their conversations.
Roxas led you to Saix and introduced him. "This is Saix. He gives us our missions and is basically second-in-command here."
"I also ensure that everyone keeps in line and obeys their orders." Saix interjected as he turned to face you. "We saw what you did during your initiation, but few of us are impressed with such lackluster strength. Once you demonstrate your true power, then we will see what you're potential is." He stated with uninterest.
You would have replied, if a sudden sound caused you to turn back to the doorway just in time to see Xion enter the room. It took only a moment for her to lock eyes with you. She stares at you for a few moments before walking up to you. "You're that boy I saw a few days ago." She stated, recognizing you rather quickly. "And they told me I was to show you the ropes, is that right, Saix?" She asked, turning to him.
"Yes, that is correct. Take him in a run through Twilight Town and see what you can teach him." Saix ordered, opening a portal there.
"Hey, Xion." Roxas called just before the two of you left. "Same place after work today, right?"
"Yeah. See you then." She replied with a smile before stepping through the portal.
You followed, wondering what that was about.
112211.title: Later that day

1122111.content:
Once you arrived, Xion began immediately taking you through the basics. Your weapon was the black shield you had called yesterday, but when it appeared, you got the distinct impression that it wasn't complete, nor was it the right type of equipment. Xion frowned at the feeble thing and shook her head. "Well, I suppose it's better than nothing..." That was all she said about it before bringing you through a few more tests, all of which you passed with only a few temporary setbacks, which you easily worked through yourself.

When the day was through, Xion called a stop. "Alright... I think that's enough for today." She turned and opened a portal back. "Go ahead and report back to Saix. I'm gonna meet with some friends before I come back." She said, about to step through.
"Wait..." You called, involuntarily, instinct screaming at you to stay as close to her as you could.
She paused, half in, half out of the portal. "What? Is something wrong?" Xion asked.
"I... Can... can I come with you?" You asked, hesitantly.
She paused, taking a few seconds to think about it.
1122111.title: An uneventful day of training later

choices: The is angry and storms away in a huff
She is embarrassed and refuses to speak to any of you
11221111.content:
Xion shrugged. "I don't see why not. Come on." She beckoned as she turned and entered the portal. You follow quickly behind and the portal closes behind you.

A bit of traveling later brings you to what you first believe to be the roof of a skyscraper on another world, but when you come to the ledge and look around, you see several areas you recognize. After taking in the view, you realize that you're on top of the station clock tower you always saw in the distance. "This is so cool." You proclaim softly in awe.
"Yeah, that's why we meet here just about every day." You turn in alarm, only to see Roxas grinning at the two of you.
"So you did bring him along. Damn... I had munny said you wouldn't." An unfamiliar voice this time made you turn again to see a tall man with spiky red hair down to his shoulders. He was carrying a grocery sack and had a mock dejected look on his face right now.
Roxas nudged him with a bigger grin. "Come on, Axel, pay up." He demanded, holding his hand out.
"Alright, alright, fine... Here, take your munny." Axel grumped, tossing Roxas a small pouch, one you assumed to be filled with coin.
Xion just sighed and shook her head at the entire exchange. "Boys." She stated, rolling her eyes.
Meanwhile, you were busy trying to sort everything out in your head.

After the whole thing, Xion introduced everyone. "Right... You guys, this is the new member, Arnoxa. Arnoxa, you already know Roxas." He nodded and smiled. "Nice to officially meet ya." He declared, shaking your hand. You given him the gesture, but inch a bit closer to Xion nervously.
"And this is Axel. He's the one who originally got us together." Xion explained. Axel grinned. "And I'm the one who keeps us together. Got it memorized?" You nod and step just behind Xion, a move that Axel notices. "Hey, Xion... You aren't babying him or anything, are ya?" He asked. Xion started in surprise, but you blushed lightly, unable to say anything to deny it. "Of course not! Why would you even think that?" She sputters, her face turning red, though whether from anger or embarrassment, it was hard to tell. "Well, cause he seems to stick pretty close to you." Axel noted.
At this, she turns to see your rather obvious movement away from her. Roxas just laughs, which eventually got Axel laughing too. You chuckle a bit, but hide it behind your hand.
Xion is flustered. How does she respond?



Personal note: the name is pronounced R-no-sha and the change in name reflects a change in author and actual character.

You look at her, a bit concerned, but Axel stops you by shoving something in front of your face. "Here, try one. They're great." He says as you look from a popsicle, to him. You take it carefully and stare at it for a few seconds.
It was light blue in color, and you could see the others licking or biting their own, so you gave yours an experimental lick as you sit down, closer to Xion. "I-it's sweet... and salty... at the same time!" You exclaim, to the amusement of the others. Xion giggles some before explaining. "Yeah. It's called sea-salt ice cream. We all love it. So? What do you think?" She asks, her earlier embarrassment gone, or so it appeared. "Ye... Yeah... It's really good." You say with a grin on your face before biting a rather large chunk out of it. That turned out to be a mistake as you soon ended up with a headache and what felt like a frozen mouth. The others chuckled at this. "Now you know not to go that fast." Roxas teased.

The day ended well, and Saix informed you of your schedule for the next few days. You hit the sack after a brief journal entry noting your day. Things seemed off to a great start now, and you looked forward to your time here.
112211112.title: She is embarrassed and refuses to speak to any ...

She does her best to explain and opens up to you.
1122111122.content:
A couple days passed with Xion leading you through all the important points of work. Just about every day after work, you, Xion, and the others would meet up for ice cream at the tower and talk. It felt like things would last forever, but one day, Saix informs you of an important mission that will be your final trial before being sent on missions alone. You grow excited because this will mean you can finally prove yourself.

You arrive at Twilight Town and begin your search for a Darkside. According to Xion, they were tall, humanoid in shape, and had to be struck in the face or hands to be taken out. It takes a good deal of searching before you catch sight of it. Unfortunately, someone got their information wrong. This one, while it looked much like a regular Darkside, was tinged with a shade of purple and gave off a strong sense of power. Xion swore under her breath and told you to stay back and try to keep out of the way. You nodded, unusually nervous about the creature. You stuck to magical support while Xion did the brunt of the damage. However, Xion was struggling, and you had run out of potions half way through the fight. Xion fell to her knees, exhausted, and you lept forward to pull her away. It was then, the heartless moved to strike. You shoved Xion out of the way and raised your shield in defense, but you were knocked back by the blow and your shield was shattered.

As you lay on the ground, you remember something. In a dream you remember a voice calling to you. "Power sleeps within you. If you give it shape, it will give you strength." This made you search desperately within yourself for what that power was. When you found it, you felt it coursing through your body. You stood up, darkness seeming to gather around you, and you called forward your weapon. However, instead of the ebony shield you were so familiar with, a long, ebony blade appeared in your hand. It was detailed in a way that made you both afraid and drawn to it. (Oblivion has been acquired. Yyyaaaaaayyyyy)

You had no time to ponder this as the heartless moved to strike again. This time, you avoided the attack and lept at the creatures face. In one stroke, you had cleaved its head in two. It vanished in a puff of darkness, leaving a heart that nearly floated away before Xion managed to catch it. "Whew...... That was close." She sighed in relief. You were too busy staring at your new weapon to say anything. It excited you now and you felt a sense of completeness you had been missing with your shield. Xion walked over and asked to inspect the blade. You hesitated, but let her look. She took it in one hand and looked it over. It gave off a bright glow that flashed briefly before fading. Xion grew wide eyed at this and looked at you in wonder.

You got concerned at this. "What? What's wrong?" She was very quiet in her reply. "This is a keyblade."
"What's a keyblade?" You asked curious to know what this was, but sensing that Xion was greatly disturbed by this. You had the feeling she might not be willing to explain.
1122111122.title: Something happens!!!

11221111221.content:
Xion shook her head. "I'm afraid I'm not really the one to say." She replied, seeming a bit regretful about it. "I do know who is, though. Once we get back and report the creature's demise, we'll go see Roxas." She stated, handing you your weapon back and opening the return portal.
You took it and stowed it away before following her through. The fact that she mentioned Roxas seemed odd to you. While you got the feeling he was a good person and a strong ally, you had never really seen him in combat. Still, you trusted Xion, so you followed her.

You arrived back at the castle and gave your report, not really surprised to find that Demyx was the source for your info. You quickly realized during your time on the field that Demyx wasn't reliable very much for anything. Still, you completed the mission and turned the heart in, glad to be done with the day, however, Xion didn't mention your keyblade, you looked at her, questioningly as she opened the way to Twilight Town and she returned your unspoken question with a tiny shake of her head.

You shrugged and followed her through, arriving at the usual spot to find Roxas there waiting for you. He waved. "Hey guys! How'd it go?" He asked, cheerily. "Well enough, if you discount the fact that Demyx got his info wrong on our target." You replied with a grin. He chuckled. "Man... Even when he does get his 'easy jobs' he still can't do them right." Xion interrupted here, wanting to get straight to the point. "Roxas... He has one too." He paused at this, looking from her to you. "Really? Well, lets see it then." You hesitated, unsure of what they were talking about, before you realized. He wanted to see your keyblade. You called it to your hand and he whistled approvingly. "Got yourself one of the good ones, too." He stated, holding his hand out. Again, you hesitated, but you let him hold it, trusting him, because Xion trusted him.

He looked it over and gave it a few swings, testing it. "This thing could really do some damage... and you only found out today?" He asked, handing it back. "Yes. That heartless almost got us, and if it hadn't arrived, we might not have made it back." You declared, stowing the weapon. "So have you told the others yet?" Roxas asked, sitting back down. Xion was quick to answer. "No. I was hoping to talk to you and Axel about it first. Speaking of which, where is he?"
"I'm right here." Axel answered, stepping around the corner with the ice cream. He passed it out and everyone sat down to eat. "So what, you have another problem needs fixing?" He asked jokingly. "Actually, we have three keys now." Roxas answered, causing Axel to look at him questioningly. "Three keys? Who's the third? I know I'm sure as hell not." He voiced, looking at the others curiously. "That would be me." You replied, waving your Popsicle in the air at him. "Arnoxa? I thought you had that weak little shield." He seemed confused. "It happened during our mission. His shield broke while we were fighting, and when he got back up, he got a keyblade instead of a shield when he called his weapon." Xion replied. Axel nodded. "Alright. So when will you let the others know?" He asked. "I was planing for tomorrow. That way we could spend the whole day working out how his role will change, who will teach him about his role, and all that." Axel thought about it. "Sounds reasonable. So which of you wanted the position?"
11221111221.title: Xion doesn't say anything and brings you to...

112211112211.content:
There were a few moments' silence before Roxas spoke up. "I guess I could. Besides, he's only ever worked with Xion before, so it'll be good for him to work with someone else." You cringed to hear the others agree with this, but you knew that you couldn't be with Xion forever.
After the day was over, the four of you met with Saix and you showed him your keyblade. This time, he almost seemed to show a bit of respect. After several minutes discussion, you were given your promotion and your training schedule with Roxas. You looked it over and noted that you would be visiting several different worlds that you hadn't been to before. You got excited and eagerly awaited the days ahead.

The next day, Roxas was waiting for you by the portal. "Alright. Our first job is in Twilight Town. I'll be showing you how we collect hearts and all the enemies to look out for. I also wanna see you in action, so expect to be doing the brunt of the fighting today." You nodded, fully understanding what this meant.
Your combat style with your shield had been an even balance of defense and offence. Your physical attacks involved throwing your shield in arcs at your enemies, using magic to ensure it always returned to you. However, now that you had an actual weapon, you would have to adjust your fighting style. You were already working through this in your head as the two of you stepped through the portal.
Once you arrived, Roxas wasted no time in beginning the training, however, he only demonstrated once how to capture hearts before giving you the reins, so to speak. You were given leadership and told that he would only provide support while you did the bulk of the job. It took you only two attempts before you were doing it right.
Fighting was a different matter, however. At first, you tried broad, two-handed attacks, the length of the blade making you believe it had the weight to make it effective, however, you quickly realized that your attacks were much faster than you expected. So you experimented with one handed strikes, and found yourself naturally switching between regular, and backhanded styles. Then, to top it off, you started switching the blade between your hands and discovered your ambidexterity. This allowed for a constantly changing style that easily tore through heartless. By the time you had collected enough hearts, you were very proud of your abilities.

Roxas watched with interest as you progressed. He never really said anything, but you got the feeling that he was impressed with you. When the last heart needed was collected, he congratulated you. "Very good. You catch on pretty quick." He said as you sent the last heart to the castle. "Now, before we head back, I have one more thing I want you to do." He said as he waved for you to follow him. You followed, curious to know what he had planned.
He led you to a wide open area with very few obstructions. He stopped in the middle of the place and summoned his keyblade. "I want you to fight me. I want to see just how well you can do with your new blade." You were surprised at this. You hadn't expected anything like this from your friend. However, the look in his eyes said that if you didn't fight, he would simply beat you down, so you readied your weapon and prepared yourself.
112211112211.title: Roxas volunteers

choices: Suppress the feeling, you need time to figure out what's wrong.
1122111122111.content:
It was difficult. You had never seen Roxas fight, so you had no idea how to react until the match began. Things started off with a bang, with Roxas throwing a firaga at you before closing in for melee combat. You managed to avoid the flames and just barely got your weapon up in time to block Roxas' first strike. However, because you hadn't put much power in it, Raxas was able to push you back. What followed was a blur of sword strokes and flares of magic that most wouldn't have been able to follow.
You knew you were keeping up with him, and had even managed to land a few blows in, and this gave you confidence. You began pushing back, and hard, moving quickly and striking hard. Roxas responded with a defensive stance, but you managed to get him to yield, however, the ease with which he recovered made you believe he had been holding back.
"That was really good. You really had me there." He declared with a grin as he attempted to catch his breath. He took a few seconds to recover before straightening up. "I had a lot of fun fighting you." He stated offering his hand.
"I did too." You responded, taking his hand firmly. "To be honest, I didn't think I'd do that well."
"Well, it's nice to know I can count on you to have my back." Roxas replied with a grin.

Once the both of you were ready, you opened the return portal and reported in. After that, you headed to the tower to meet with the others. You got there rather late, but you only saw Axel there. He was already half finished with a Popsicle by the time you arrived. "Hey guys. I was starting to think you weren't gonna show." He waved with a grin. "Well, I wanted to see how good he really was. That meant sparing." Roxas declared.
Axel turned eagerly. "So who won?"
"I did, but just barely." You answered, sitting down.
"Oh, don't be so modest." Roxas teased, sitting in the middle. "You had me hands down and you know it."
Axel interrupted. "So wait... The noob here basically whooped your butt and he's only had his weapon for two days? That's kinda sad, Roxas." He declared with only a hint of actual sadness.
"I went easy on him. You think I wanted to put him out for a week?" Roxas shot back.
"Hah! I knew it! I knew you were holding back." You threw in, now that your suspicions were confirmed.

The rest of the time was spent with just the three of you, teasing each other and joking around. Roxas, at one point, went to get ice cream for the two of you, and you stayed long enough to finish it. Axel left once his was gone, and Roxas followed not long after.
You stayed there another few minutes, looking your stick over. It said winner on it, but you had no idea what it meant. You were just about to leave when Xion showed up.
"Hey... Sorry I'm late." She replied, obviously out of breath. The mission took longer than I thought it would." She huffed as she moved over to sit down.

The two of you were alone, and you were beginning to feel awkward around her. Your eyes kept going back to her, tracing her face and body, to the point where you were only half listening to her. You felt so strange around her, which was odd, because you rarely ever FELT anything. How will you handle this?
1122111122111.title: You win... or did Roxas just go easy on you?

As you run after the man not wanting to get lost in a city made up of nothing but graves you notice that the Nobodies aren't pursuing you but heading off down a side streeting that leads to a diffrent part of the city...this confuses you but you don't voice your confusion to your new comrade...after a few minutes of running the stranger in front of you stops and turns with a grin.

"Who told you I'd be here?" you inquire confused.
"Why Master Eddoe of course," Emericson laughed, "He knows much that goes on in this world...he knows why your here."
"Please you've got to help me!" you shout praying that the man before you is willing to aid you.

"Emricson!" someone shouted behind us and I turned to see a man in black pants, knee high leather boots that reminded me of pirate boots, a white shirt with cuffs at the wrists, a mustard colored vest covered the shirt, round glasses, gray eyes, a head of shoulder length black hair, and a huge halberd slung on his back, "We don't have time to aid this welp!"
"But Master Eddoe," Emericson whined...This was the great Eddoe, "Who says he can't help us with our research?"
"I do," Eddoe hissed angrily, "The avatar of Death is not something to be trifled with!"
"Avatar of Death?" you asked confuse and curious.
"The being known as the Reaper," Eddoe sighed, "He is one of the many Avatars that wander the worlds."
"Is he evil?" you ask eager to learn more.
"No...no avatar is good or evil," Eddoe hissed shifting slightly, "Avatars represent the many diffrent forces in the worlds...Life, Death, Justice, Greed, Purity, Corruption so on and so forth...and I'm here to study one of them and your bumbling may have chased him off."
"Wait why would he be afraid of me?" you inquired confused.
"He's not afraid of you," Eddoe snarled seemingly offended by the comment, "He's afraid of those creatures capturing him as they did the damned witch!"
"Wait...witch?" you were caught off guard by this comment.
"Yeah isn't that who your here to ask about?" Emericson chimed in, "Silver hair...named Najil?"
"I don't have time for this," Eddoe snarled, "Emericson...we're leaving...NOW!"

Your eyes fly wide open. "Oh, just a dream." you mutter to yourself. This "dream", though seemed very vivid, almost as if you were there. Most dreams, you just forget about the details and only remember a vague outline on what's the dream about after you wake up, but not this one. This one, you could remember every little detail with ease. "Well, might as well get out of bed." you think to yourself. You jump out of bed and stretch. You look around the room, not all that impressive, though it's home. You share your room with your younger sister, since you two are the younger side of the family, you being twelve, while your sister being seven. Your older brother and sister share a room as well. Your brother being sixteen, while your sister is fifteen. Your mother is alone, since your father died from heart attack when you were eight. His lose is still grevius to you, but you did not brood over it. You have been bullied a lot during your life, being 4.6 and having very little athletic skill, attracts many of the other boys to tease you. You are relatively light skinned, and you have short blonde hair. Your name is Rune.

Your little sister (Abby) remained fast asleep in bed, curled up with her stuffed rabbit. You grinned at her. Although she is five years younger than you are, she is, and will always be your favorite sibling. You walked downstairs, and poured yourself some cereal. As you ate it, you reflected on your dream. Okay, you were on a pedestal with a mural of a character made by a well known company etched on it. You were given a choice of 'paths' and you chose the rod. Maybe... no this dream cannot mean anything, although now that you thought about it, you did feel the same sensation as when you touched the rod, as if you could wield the might of an army with your mind.

Dreams about little dark creatures scampering around, people in black cloaks/jackets, but most importanly, you kept having visions about doors. A white door in the middle of a vortex a blackness.

You live in a town. The sky is pale blue and the clouds drift lazily by like a herd of buffalo. You wish you could be high up there, where life is wild and adventurous, but instead you're in a town where everyday is the same and every dull moment takes a year.

You are daydreaming on top of your roof, as per usual, when suddenly you hear shouts from below.

12131.content:
PWIK!! FWOO~~!

You toss the shingle from your roof, aiming for the robber. You believe the law has the right hand in this one! Just as it's about to make direct contact... Swwoo~~! The shingle passes right through him! Even the police are surprised! You gape at the sight, and all of the sudden the figure in black disappears! You look around for the strange person who teleported away, and suddenly you're being gagged! You struggle and kick, but find nothing behind you!! You make a final reach out into the distance, and then, you're gone!

Falling through blackness, never-ending darkness... You fear it more than anything! You scream out for help, nothing!! Then, as fast as the darkness appeared, it dispells. You're standing on terrain that resembles your hometown, except... There's not a soul there. You look around frantically, what's going on?!

Behind you stands the robber, still cloaked in black. You pick up a rock, and throw it at him! Of course it was in vain...

"Shhh, quiet, you!"

The hooded figure silences you, and once you have calmed down, however slightly, he removes his hood. Underneath is a bright purple head of hair, and you're shocked to see the face to go with it! What a strange looking person...

"My name is Xetetras."

"You're a thief!!"

"No, actually, I'm a recoverer..."

From inside his sleeve, Xetetras produces a glowing orb of some sort. It resembles a crystal ball.

"You see this?"

"Yeah, I see a crystal ball..."

"Well, back where you were, you wouldn't have been able to see that. They assumed I stole something because it took the form of a precious gemstone bracelet. This crystal ball you see is actually made of spirits... Souls."

You shudder at the power of such a sight. Then, you begin to wonder...

"Hey, then, why am I here? What did you take me for?"

"That's because this orb belongs to you."

"Me?"

Xetetras hands you the ball, and you juggle it in your palms. Something does seem daftly familiar about it... But you're terribly confused.

"Hey, if this belongs to me... Why don't I remember it?"

He laughs.

"You wouldn't, you had it a long time ago..."

He takes your hand.

"Memory wiped? What are you talking about?! I don't even know you!!"

You throw aside Xetetras' hand, and cross your arms. Something in you produces tears, you're crying now!

"You do, you just can't remember it anymore. I'm not allowed to remember your name, just know your face... So, we're almost perfect strangers. But, we used to be closer than anything. 1221.content:
For the most part, you could remember the dream. You remember feeling the rod in your hands... The voice seemingly from nowhere... The sound of glass breaking and the feeling of falling...

But then you take stock of your surroundings again. Your room was... not necessarily barren, but being a family living out in the sticks, you preferred practicality to fanciness(to the constant chagrin of your mother). Your family was one of just a few in a village right on the outskirts of the forest. Your father was the tanner and cobbler and your mother, a seamstress. You had an older brother who was dead set on learning your father's trade and a younger sister who looked up to you like you could never do wrong. She was always begging to learn mother's seamstress work alongside you, and you found it difficult to simply say no. You cared about your family, even if you didn't always agree, and often times you felt like things should always be this simple and easy.
Most of the time, at least...
Sometimes, as you wandered the village, you would look out to the forest and wonder, 'What would I find if I actually went out and looked around?' Of course, without the strength to carry a weapon, much less weild one, you never had a hope of convincing your parents that you would be fine for just an hour or two. But still, your curiosity refused to simply sit in the corner of your mind. So eventually, you hatched a plan.
As one of the few family members capable of reading, you had spent long hours pouring over the few books you could borrow that contained any information on different dangers that lay outside your little village. Books on practically everything, from different insects and where they liked to stay, to animals and their preffered food, to what plants produced food that was safe to eat. Anything and everything you could get ahold of, you read. It got to the point where your parents were openly discussing letting you apprentice to the village elder, so that you might serve as his secretary and assistant. You had something else in mind, though.
You were only 14 at the time, and not even old enough to be considered an adult yet, but you knew that, in time your family would start pressuring you into getting into a vocation and settling down, even getting married eventually. You knew you had the answers you needed as to how you would survive, but you needed someone to teach you how to defend yourself. The only problem was the tiny village barely had anyone who knew how to fight like a soldier, and you weren't exactly the most fit of your family. Knowing that you would be forced to make a decision soon, you came up with a comprimise. You'd need a weapon of some kind, which meant conviscing the town blacksmith to forge you one, which would be difficult under the best of circumstances, so you'd need some way of earning his trust or buying his services. either way would take time, so your options were limited. You could...
1221.title: A Diamond in the Rough

1223.content:
A Rustic Town…A Vivid Dream

A dream…It was all just a dream…
The sounds of her alarm clock ringing loudly in her ears awaken her; a sign that she’s already late for school.
In this quiet little town, far from the big cities, nothing much ever happened. People in the neighborhood knew and practically grew up with each other. Over the years, nothing much has changed. Time, it seems, became a stand still when you’re there.
In fact, the town itself is going rustic. Improvements have not been made through the years which left it unchanged and uninterested to entice people to live and build their businesses there. Residents either have strong family roots in the place or just wants to live somewhere quiet away from bustling city life, are the ones that stayed despite its bleak appearance.
Yet somewhere in that quiet little town… a girl dreamed of something that can change its future…
Lately, she realized that she’s been sleeping a lot. She didn’t know if it’s a sign of sickness or something. There’s really nothing wrong with it except that she’s also having some weird dream. Dreams, which you feel is real even after you wake up. Just like last night…
“A rod? Not just an ordinary rod but a magical one with an alluring voice that lulls you…As if something like that could happen in reality?” she thought to herself
She was on her way to class and passed by the washroom when a voice suddenly spoke behind her…
When 16 stars and moons shall pass…
The time of fate has come…
Destiny waits…
She looked around but no one was there. That voice, it seems so familiar. She stopped by the washroom to freshen herself up, thinking that it must have been her imagination.
She was in the midst of washing her face when the air around her suddenly felt cold. She looked in the mirror, hoping to see a ghost but there was none yet the room temperature was rapidly decreasing.
Just then, something cold and wet landed on her nose.
“A snowflake?” she wondered when she touched and felt its texture. A second has only passed by when more were falling from the roof.
“Huh? Snow in the washroom?” Pretty weird, right?
When she looked down, the floor tiles have disappeared but ere now replaced by frozen ice, like she was standing in the middle of a frozen lake.
A part of her dream suddenly whizzed through her mind and her eyes widened in alarmed when she realized what will happen next. Her guess have not taken too long as the whole floor suddenly cracked and shattered in a million pieces, revealing a deep abyss and you falling into it…
A voice in the distance started calling her. In her slumber state, she can vaguely comprehend what that someone is saying…All she could feel right now is that she landed on something soft…
1223.title: A Rustic Town, A Vivid Dream

12233.content:
That voice inside her head was still persistent, determined to make a connection with her. Bit by bit, she can now understand what it’s saying…
You came little one…
There is strength inside you…
It’s time to wake up now…
Wake up!
Wake me up! Wake me up!
The last sentence was uttered in such an urgent state that woke her up from her fall. Cold and white was the first thing that popped in her mid as he slowly opened her eyes. Snow was falling everywhere and it seems that she landed on a huge pile of it that cushions her fall.
In the distance, she could make out a building or what was left of it, on a closer look. She sought shelter there and was amazed to see that it wasn’t just an ordinary building. In fact, it was like a large ruin of some sort.
And there in the middle of all the ruins that are now covered in snow lies the mystical rod in her dreams, guarded by what appeared to be three huge statues frozen in ice.
Taking a closer look, she realized that each of the statues were animals. To the left, is a white tiger with sapphire eyes that glows despite its stationery gaze; and to the right, is a silver fox standing proud and majestic; gracefulness and subtlety emanating from its motionless form; and in the center was a large black dragon standing quietly in center yet emitting an aura of danger if touched. What caught her attention too is the dark ruby in the middle of its forehead shaped like an eye.
Come take me…
She could hear that voice again, enticing her to come forward, though now she could tell that it was coming from the mystical rod that the statues guarded.
Slowly, as if in a trance, she walked over to where the rod was not minding those fearsome looking statues, her mind it seems is just focused on the rod. She was just about to take it, her hands inches away when caution (her true self) took place and stopped. The voice spoke again.
Don’t run away now…
You’ve been doing that all your life…
So much strength inside…
So little confidence…
One choice…that’s all it takes…
The words struck her, a bitter reminder of her character. So she threw caution to the wind and abruptly held it. The moment her hands touched the rod, aloud cry was heard above the sky, like someone or something is in great pain. The whole area shook with the force of the voice. She was starting to panic as the earth moved at her feet but the rod’s voice stopped her in place, its presence in her mind soothing her.
It all happened so fast, one final cry and then wham! Something cracked then shattered into pieces. The rod suddenly shone so brightly that her eyes were blinded for a moment. Just then, a deep male voice spoke behind her as the blinding light disappears…
At last, I’ve awaken…

Then, Yen Sid gestured toward another circle that appeared on the floor infront of you. It contained strange white creatures, they looked like they wore strange jump suits. "And these, are the nobodies." Yen Sid explained, "A nobody is a creature of which is left behind when a heart is consumed by heartless. They are made of body and soul. This is due to the fact that when darkness consumes the heart, it creates a heartless. A nobody is the remaining parts left behind by the heart, giving a nobody form, and the soul, giving it life."

You shook your head, confused. "I don't understand... Why must I do this? What am I here for?"

Yen Sid closed his eyes, "You see, child... Heartless are possessed by Maleficent, the evil dark witch. She is using them to consume other hearts,creating heartless. She then summons the heartless on other worlds, so that she can fulfill her goal."

"What's her goal?" You ask.

"Her goal is to take over the worlds."

You nod, "Yeah... That's what she said."

Yen Sid nods, "That is why you must be prepared. You must know what you are dealing with, under any circumstance. You are chosen to do this, child."

You nod, getting the gist of your quest. "I see... So I have to stop Maleficent?"

Yen Sid nods, and the nobodies dissolve. He points to another circle on the floor, which contained holographs of hooded men in long black coats. "And watch out for the Organization XIII. They only cause trouble."

"Who are they?" You ask.

"They are Nobodies."

"Nobodies? But I thought nobodies were those strange white figures."

"You see," He pointed at the men again, "When someone's heart is consumed, they turn into a heartless, which also creates the lesser nobodies. However, once someone has a powerful heart and strong will, the nobody takes the form of the original humans appearance, with only slight changes."

You cock your head to the side. "So... If a heartless were to consume a heart of powerful and strong will, they would still be human?" You ask.

"Not exactly... These type of nobodies lack emotion also. They may appear to be normal, but they have lost their hearts. That is why they want more hearts, and that is why you must be careful."

You shake your head, still confused of your whereabouts.
