His visible eye met your gaze, and hastily looked away. "I'm just... searching for something..." He said.

You eyed him up and down, and shook your head slowly, "What are you looking for?" You asked.

"I... I don't really know... I guess I'm searching for an answer... An answer to who I really am." He said in a gloomy tone.

Soon, he gave you a new impression. You no longer felt irritated or suspicious about him, but rather felt light compassion and sympathy for him. You seemed to have something in common with this particular heartless, soul. "Me too..." You said, troubled.

He immediately met your gaze again. "I don't even remember my name." He said.

"R-really?"

He nodded, "I just go by Xulan... But I know that's not my true name." Again, he took his gaze off of you, and turned around. "I should be going. I don't want to agitate my master. I've kept him waiting..."

You turn your head behind you to several young voices, shouting out "STRUGGLE!". You quickly turn your head back around and the nobody had vanished.
12322212211211222111222121111221111.title: Tells you more about himself.

123222122112112221112221211112211111.content:
Figuring you had no other leads, you followed the voices... back the way you came. As you got closer, you could hear other sounds, such as cheering, smacks, and yelling.

"And the Winner is... Seifer!" Someone shouts on a mic. Sounds like some sort of big event is taking place.

You enter an open space and you could see someone set a stage up, and currently a teenager with blondish hair stood on it, holding up a foam sword. (you assume this is Seifer)

Looks like this is some sort of sword fighting contest...
123222122112112221112221211112211111.title: Struggle

1232221221121122211122212111122111111.content:
The rather largish judge reviews over a chart in his hand. "Now up against Seifer is-" "Wait!" you shout.

All eyes turn on you. "Well... what do we have here?" The judge asked, seeming amused.

"I may not look like much, but I want to join this 'struggle'" you continue.

The judge ponders this before saying, "Since there's a shortage of contestants, I will let you join. But next time, you need to sign up earlier." The Judge said. "The rules are on that billboard over there, come talk to me again after you familiarize with them
1232221221121122211122212111122111111.title: Enter

choices: Enter the struggle tournament now and teach Seifer a lesson!
Practice before you entering. You don't want to be humiliated.
12322212211211222111222121111221111111.content:
You self-consciously, and slowly walked toward the billboard, aware of many eyes placed on you, possibly following your every move. You scanned your eyes briefly through the many pages on the billboard, until your eyes met with a page that read "STRUGGLE:RULES" in large, bold letters.

"The STRUGGLE Tournament consists of a few simple rules: Each participant begins with 100 colored orbs. Every time one of the participants is hit, they'll drop colored orbs (participants each hold different colored orbs; one blue, one red). Collecting the opponents' orbs will increase your score, but opponents can also regain their orbs by simply picking them up. There's also a time limit. You must obtain more orbs than your opponent before the given time ends. If one participant collects all 200 orbs within the given time limit, that participant is granted success, and automatically wins the STRUGGLE match. May the best STRUGGLER win!

-- You will be provided the appropriate STRUGGLE gear. A participant of use of any foreign object will be DISQUALIFIED."

You rush back to the judge, "I'm ready to join the struggle tournament!" You said, inspired.

"Are you sure you're ready to STRUGGLE?" He asked, trying to convince you that this 'struggle' was 'dangerous' or 'serious business'.

"I'm positive, sir." You nodded, reassuringly.

His face changed from a stern, serious face, to a large, prideful grin. "That a girl. What's your name?"

"Anna"

You looked to the direction of which Seifer's voice came. He was making brash, cocky comments about the others being 'losers' and 'failures'. "Is that all you losers got? You're pathetic!" Seifer said to another boy with blond hair, wearing camouflage pants that knelt before him. " I can't believe you thought that you actually had a chance of winning. I ALWAYS win."

The sound of his over confidence and teasing voice disturbed you. You could only think of how ignorant and ridiculous he sounded, which made you even more eager to compete in the struggle tournament.
12322212211211222111222121111221111111.title: The rules

choices: Talk to Hayner, try and calm him down.
123222122112112221112221211112211111111.content:
Confidence filled your heart, and inspired you to enter the tournament. "Sir, I'm ready now. I want to struggle." You told the judge.

The judge nodded, " I like your attitude, kid." He presented you a piece of paper with few names written on it, "Just sign here, and you'll officially be apart of the STRUGGLE tournament!" He noted.

You took the pen, and scribbled your signature on the piece of paper, below the name 'Hayner'. You assumed that Hayner was the boy with the camoflauge pants, since nobody seemed to have cheered for him, except for a girl and a stubby fat guy.

As you were busy studying the unfamiliar faces in the crowd, several minutes had passed without your notice.The judge lifted a mic to his face, and announced 'a new participant.' "We have here, a new participant!" He gestured to you-- Of course! You're the new participant! You better tighten up, and get ready to rumble, because all eyes are on you now. "The girl who has seemed to come from nowhere, ANNNNNAAAHH!" He cheered, and everyone cheered and applauded along with him.

You followed the gestures of the judge, which lead you onto the large stage. He handed you a styrofoam (or plastic) weapon, and you held it firmly, ready to struggle.

The blond boy with the camouflage pants emerged from the crowd, and stepped onto the stage. "Now in the left corner, he's got strength, he's got attitude, he's the one and only HAYNEERRR!!" The judge pronounced his name boldly, but not a large majority of the crowd was cheering along, or even made noise.

Hayner stared you in the eye, "... Maybe beating you will hide my humiliation..." He said in a gloomy tone.

He seemed to be having a rough time. It seemed like everyone was having a rough time... You weren't quick to judge, though, and you minded your own business. You wouldn't let curiosity get in the way of winning the struggle tournament!

Within an instant, Hayner charged toward you at full force, and smacked his struggle bat at you, releasing blue orbs, which he collected quickly. You tried the same, but had missed the swing! Hayner evaded many of your attacks, and was in the lead before you knew it. You knew you had to up your game, but it wouldn't be easy.

You decided to try apprehending his moves, and formed a sturdy, defensive stance. Sooner than you knew it, you were in the lead by 80 orbs! The time was flying by fast, and you needed to dominate your orbs for victory!

A few minutes, which felt like seconds, had passed, and you were successful the first round.

Hayner threw his fists in a fury, and slammed his feet into the ground. "I can't believe it! I suck!" His voice was full of rage.

You won, so you...
123222122112112221112221211112211111111.title: STRUGGLE!! -Hayner

1232221221121122211122212111122111111111.content:
Well, you did feel sorry for Hayner, but you're so eager to beat up Seifer, so comforting Hayner doesn't come to mind "after all, I'll do that when the tournament is over." you say to yourself.

Something about Seifer just irks you. Your not sure if it's the way he swaggers as he walks, or if it is his big mouth, or how he looked at other people, his eyes always reflected arrogance.

"And now Seifer vs. Anna!" The judge pronounced, followed by cheering from the crowd.

You both stood in opposite sides of the stage, you dropping into a fighting stance, Seifer leveling his sword at you.

"Hmm, your pretty tough... for a girl that is." He says to you in a mocking voice. "Why don't you kneel, loser!"

This insult caused you to grit your teeth. Nothing irked you more than being discriminated just because of your gender.

"Maybe you'll think differently once this girl beats you!" you shout back.

"Look at the sparks fly!" the judge announced to the audience. "Struggle!" the judge shouted
1232221221121122211122212111122111111111.title: Anna vs. Seifer

1232221221121122211122212111122111111111.content:
With a cry, you charge at Seifer attempting a cut to the chest. However, Seifer leaps backwards and hits you on the head, causing a burst of blue orbs flying out. He follows this with a stab to the chest, then he pushed you backwards. Although you hated this guy, you had to admit, he's pretty good at this.

The next charge, you tried another strategy, you feinted a charge, causing Seifer to flinch, then you stepped to the side, and hit him on the back. Causing orbs to bleed out of him. You followed this by a barrage of attacks, Seifer made attempts to parry them, but much to his dismay, you were swatting his sword away like a fly.

Before Seifer's orb count got too low, he managed to disengage and limp to the edge of the stage. Forgetting the importance of strategy, you charge, just in time toi get wacked upside the head with his sword. Seifer grinned, about to follow that with an equally deadly move when...

"TIME!!!"
1232221221121122211122212111122111111111.title: continue

choices: Assume that he is a cheater!
1232221221121122211122212111122111111111.content:
"And the winner is..." The judge paused, increasing the tension, "SEIFER!" The crowd went wild.

Your heart dropped. You were disappointed... You knew you should have practiced before attempting to enter the tournament. But Seifer's attitude urged you to enter, and it was hard to fight that urge. Maybe you were being just as over-confident as Seifer was.

"Haha!" Seifer guffawed, "I told you. I always win, and no girl is gonna change that." He said in his irksome tone, that irritated you.

You swung your bat at him, but he had deflected the blow, knocking you to your knees.

"That's better." He said, "On your knees, where you belong."

You clenched your fists in anger, but remained on your knees. You felt humiliated... How was it possible? How did he win? You were positive that you hit him several more times than he had.
1232221221121122211122212111122111111111.title: continue

choices: Make an effort to comfort him. Try to be his friend.
1232221221121122211122212111122111111111.content:
You began to walk away, your head hanging in disappointment."I'm not through with you, Seifer... I'll come back... and I'll win." You said quietly, but loud enough for Seifer to hear your threat.

"Awww... How cute." Seifer mocked, "I just can't wait to get a slice of that!"

You continued to step further, as vengeful anger and spite spiraled through your mind. You caught yourself uttering curse words and vengeful quotes that slipped out of your raging thoughts. Then, you began to think of how ridiculous you were acting. Perhaps it is true that you were once lost in the darkness, and never found, since your thoughts were only reflecting such ways of behavior.

You soon approached a small part of town. It was bright, and colorful, which soothed your troubled thoughts. A small train followed narrow tracks that cruised through town. Many of the buildings were covered in "STRUGGLE" advertising posters, seeming as if they were mocking you.

As you contemplated the town thoroughly, you confronted Hayner, from the struggle tournament.

"Hey." You greeted him warmly. "Hayner, isn't it?"

"Yeah." He replied in a somber tone. "Anna... Right?"

You nodded. "Seifer's a real wise guy." You said in sarcasm. You tried to engage a topic that would catch his attention.

"Yeah... Wise guy." He echoed.

"Don't worry about it. He's a jerk anyways." You said, trying to assemble his comfort.

Hayner rolled his eyes, and turned away. "Just leave me alone... I'm not in the mood." He mumbled.
1232221221121122211122212111122111111111.title: Walk away.

choices: Ask Hayner to escort you through the town.
1232221221121122211122212111122111111111.content:
"Come on, It's okay, you can tell me what's bothering you." You said, abounding comfort towards him.

He turned around, and faced you. "You think it's okay to lose over and over again to that stupid Seifer guy?!" He barked.

"Don't worry," You tried to innovate his mood, "I lost to him too."

His unhappy, gloomy face soon reformed to an unhappy, furious scowl. "Great!" He belowed, "Now I lost to a girl that lost to Seifer! It was bad enough to lose to Seifer alone!"

His hostile mood pestered you. "Hey! He wasn't easy!" You snapped back.

"Exactly! Now people are going to think that I'm totally and utterly pathetic, losing to a girl that lost to Seifer!"

Your spine enlarged, and a scowl drew upon your face. "He won, and there's nothing I could do! My gender has nothing to do with it!"

He rolled his eyes, "I don't care what you think! I'm just sick of losing!"

The hostile atmosphere disappeared, and turned silent. You pondered for a moment, "What if... I beat him?" You inquired, "And I'll win for you!"

His brown eyes narrowed and glared you down. "And how do propose you do that? Trust me, I--"

He was interrupted by your claims, "I'll prove it to you and to Seifer, and it will be the last time anyone underestimates a female. I'll prove everyone that girls can do anything that boys can!" You implied with confidence.

Hayner scratched his head, "Hey... I like the way you think." He said, "If you beat Seifer, that'll get all the stress off my back, and everyone will leave me alone!"

You and Hayner both smiled reassuringly, certain that you would be successful the next round of the tournament.

Hayner invited you over to a place he called "The Usual Spot", where he engaged with his friends. You assumed his friends were the two kids that were seen with him earlier, also eating blue ice cream.
1232221221121122211122212111122111111111.title: Make an effort to comfort him. Try to be his fr...

choices: Ignore him/her and hope he/she will go away...
Say something to the nobody, and demand to know what he/she wants!
1232221221121122211122212111122111111111.content:
Once you arrived at the 'Usual Spot', Hayner introduced you to his two friends.

"Pence, Olette, this is Anna. She's a new friend." He said reassuringly, wrapping his arm around your shoulder. "This is Pence," He said, pointing to the shaggy-haired, chubby, flaccid boy wearing loose clothes.

Pence greeted you with a hearty welcoming. "Hey there! Nice to meet you!"

"My name's Olette." She greeted, flashing a pleasant smile, "Nice meeting you."

You smiled back at your new friends, followed by dead silence. It was odd. It was just too quite. It was uncomfortable. You came to realize that your new acquaintances were frozen in time. All time had stopped. You stepped backwards, startled, mindless and utterly speechless. You stepped back again, and felt a cold, dark shadow cast over you.

It was another member of the Organization XIII...
1232221221121122211122212111122111111111.title: Continue to the "Usual Spot"...

1232221221121122211122212111122111111111.content:
After your performance in the struggle, you were in no mood for a fight, after all, it's possible this Nobody didn't have any business with you. Regaining your composure, you attempt to walk past him and out of the "usual spot."

However, you are not so lucky, as you are about to pass him/her, the nobody raises his hand in front of you.

"What do you want!" You demand.
1232221221121122211122212111122111111111.title: Ignore him/her and hope he/she will go away...

choices: Make something up; tell them it was an accident.
1232221221121122211122212111122111111111.content:
This close up, you interpreted the nobody was a male. The stranger did not respond, nor did he reveal his face. He mumbled something under a foreign tongue, his voice much too deep for Xulan's, and swung his arm downward.

"W-what... What was that about?!" You bellowed. "What do you want?!"

"We want you back, Anna." He mumbled.

As he said this, a vague memory of this particular nobody ran through your mind, but you didn't know why, or how you remembered him. You never really remembered your life before the age of 10, and you were only 15 now. The life you thought you had seemed fake. Your old friends, your parents, your brother, Roxx. None of them really seemed to matter, because you never really shared anything special with them. Were they just made up from your own head? Nothing seemed to make sense anymore...

The hooded man inched closer, and took your hand with a vigorous grasp, holding it firmly. His fingernails were sharp, and were digging into your skin, causing you to bleed.

"Stop it!" You cried, and closed your eyes, tightly, hoping he would disappear.

The pressure on your hand had stopped. You opened your eyes, and the nobody had vanished. You ran back to Hayner and his friends, yelling their names.

"Are you guys alright?" You asked in worry. "He didn't hurt you, did he?"

Hayner, Pence and Olette granted a erratic look upon you.

"... Are YOU alright?" Hayner asked, as if you were crazy.

Pence's eyes widened, "Your hand! It's bleeding!" He exclaimed, pointing at you. "Your hand is bleeding!"
1232221221121122211122212111122111111111.title: Someone else.

1232221221121122211122212111122111111111.content:
"umm... I... a... I tripped and hit my hand." you lie. You were always a bad liar, but this lie seemed to work.

"Just don't hurt yourself again." Hayner said to you as Pence examined the wound on your hand.

"This doesn't look like a falling wound." Pence said to himself as he staunched the bleeding and bandaged your hand.
1232221221121122211122212111122111111111.title: bluff

1232221221121122211122212111122111111111.content:
(( Correction: you are 16. I had a spelling error, and didn't realize until now... ))

"Yeah, weird." You said, nervously.

"There, that should do it!" Pence insisted as he finished bandaging your hand.

A few moments had passed, and the 4 of you were just talking. You were a little distracted from your flying thoughts, and began to study your wounded hand.

"Hey," Hayner looked at you and said, grasping your attention, "Don't worry about your hand, okay?"

"Yeah, it'll heal." Olette said reassuringly.

You think for a moment, then nod. "I doubt anything will get any worse."
1232221221121122211122212111122111111111.title: continue

1232221221121122211122212111122111111111.content:
"Where do you live?" Olette asked out of the blue.

"Did you move here?" Pence continued. "This is the first time we've seen you."

You stand there, with a blank look on your face, before eventually replying...
1232221221121122211122212111122111111111.title: Continue.

1232221221121122211122212111122111111111.content:
While hanging out with Hayner, Pence, and Ollete was nice and all, you had bigger questions nagging at your mind.
What business did that member of Organization 13 have with you, What did Yen Sid mean by destiny, and of course, all the mysteries of your past.
You did feel bad about abandoning your new friends, but these questions need answers and fast.

You stand up and declare "I'm sorry, I need to go somewhere."

Your friends, especially Hayner seemed a little taken a back by this (after all, you just got here).

"Where are you going?" Ollete asked.

You decided to tell the truth "I have questions that need answering."

"Shall we come with you?" Pence asked.

"Thanks for the offer, but this is something I must do alone." You turn and smile. "Don't worry, I'll be back." before you walk out of the usual spot.

a moment of silence permeated among your stunned companions.

"That was strange." Pence said.
1232221221121122211122212111122111111111.title: Continue.

choices: Use the darkness... just this once
1232221221121122211122212111122111111111.content:
After a couple minutes of walking, you realized you embarked on a journey, without the faintest idea of where to go... or even how to travel to those places.

You needed to think this through, so you walked into a darker corner of a park (you found the dark very comforting) and sat down on a bench.

Your corrupted keyblade appeared in your lap, in all it's dark and corrupted splendor. Just as you remember it, black blade with red lines going though it, almost as if the sword were bleeding from multiple cuts sliced through it. and, of course, the cracked heart in the middle of the hilt.

Wielding it seemed to open a whole new world to you, you could almost smell the darkness in the people around (who seemed strangely oblivious to the fact that someone in the park is holding a deadly weapon in her hand). The darkness took on a strong bitter smell. Some people smelled more strongly of darkness than others, but the strongest smell, by far was of course you.

For some reason, Yen Sid assigned you to this adventure, despite knowing you were a softie for darkness. He must've had a reason for it...

Your mind went back to your first concern, transportation. You didn't want to use the darkness, yet... how else will you move around....
1232221221121122211122212111122111111111.title: pondering the darkness

1232221221121122211122212111122111111111.content:
What the heck, it's just this one time, you won't get dragged back in just if you use it once.

When you made this decision, the methods of how to use the darkness to teleport came immediately.

You closed your eyes and the darkness surrounded you, carrying you away. It felt very soothing in fact, as if you were letting out a breath of air you had unknowingly held in all your life.

When you opened your eyes, you found yourself in...
1232221221121122211122212111122111111111.title: Use the darkness... just this once

1232221221121122211122212111122111111111.content:
The darkness appears to have miscalculated your destination, since you're falling down a hole... quite a peculiar hole in fact. As you fall down, clocks, kitchen appliances, doors, tables, chairs, etc. were studded on the dirt wall. You were so absorbed in the wall, that you didn't notice the coming floor, which you landed on, behind first with an audible thud.

"Ow!" you reflexively moaned. You got to your feet and looked around the room. Just a round room with red and pink checker tiled floor, and four couches surrounding you.

"What a strange place." you said to yourself. You would've pondered more, but a white rabbit who wore a red jacket, held a watch, and... wait anthropomorphic white rabbit!!!!!!!!! WTH!!!!!!!!!!!!!

"I'm late! I'm late! I'm late!" The Rabbit screamed, panicking as it ran passed you.

"um... exc-" but he cut you off.

"oh dear, oh dear, oh dear, I'm here, I should be there." the rabbit panted before running into a hallway you had not noticed until now. "Oh the queen, she'll have my head for sure!"

What was that all about!
1232221221121122211122212111122111111111.title: Falling down a hole!?

1232221221121122211122212111122111111111.content:
"Hey, wait!" You called to him, pacing after him.

The flustered rabbit swung open a door. He scurried through the door, screaming, "I'm late! I'm late!"

His voice echoed, as he ran further and further away. You couldn't see the rabbit anymore, and you assumed he wasn't very far, so you decided to keep trailing after him.

You peeked into the door the strange rattled rabbit had left open behind him-- wait, there were two larger doors overlapping a smaller door. Three doors for one entrance? What's the point? You thought for a moment, as you started twisting the door nobs in confusion. You regained your focus, and entered the room.

You stepped into a perfectly rectangular room. It had a small round table in the middle of it, with doors of many diverse sizes that surrounded the perimeter. The door sizes were very odd. Some were smaller than others, wider, narrower, larger, and all sorts of different sizes. You turned the nob of a door to the left that was closest to you, and pushed and pulled, but it wouldn't budge. You tried the same with many other doors, but not a single door would open.

You heard a creaking noise from behind you. You snapped your head back behind you promptly, and before you could leap for the door, the door you came from slammed shut. It was locked too!

"Ah! My keyblade!" You thought. Your calamitous and corrupt keyblade materialized in your hand, as you said to yourself, "You got me in this mess, you're getting me out of it!"

You used your keyblade on one of the doors. You tried pulling and pushing it open, but it still wouldn't budge! It was obvious it was being barricaded by something on the other side of it. You tried it on a couple of other doors, but to your dismay, they were barricaded as well.

You sat down for a few seconds, twiddling with your thumbs, pondering on your whereabouts, when a door that was slightly opened caught your eye...
1232221221121122211122212111122111111111.title: Go after the rabbit

1232221221121122211122212111122111111111.content:
Sadly for you, the slightly opened door you observed was much too small to enter, you estimate three-four inches high. You sighed, and were about to go back to twiddling your thumbs, when you witnessed a tiny white shape enter the door. You turned just in time to see a miniature white rabbit enter the...

wait, it's the same whit rabbit whom you followed into this mess.

You were about to stop him and ask... how you get out of the room perhaps? But the rabbit vacated the room and closed the miniature door behind him.

"How did he get so small?" you ask yourself as you examine the previously opened door.

"No, no, you're simply too big." A voice replied.

You jumped back in surprise, and stared, aghast at the doorknob.

"It talks!?" you screamed.

"Don't be so loud, you woke me up." The doorknob replied in a hoarse voice.

"Uh...umm...uh..." You stammered. "Tell me how to leave this room."

"Why don't you try the bottle... over there." The doorknob stated while gesturing toward the table.

You looked back to see, to your surprise, a bottle on the table.

Normally, you would be wary about drinking from a bottle that contained unknown contents, but for know, the bottle was your only clue on how to get out of this room.

You walk over to the table, seize the bottle, and down the contents.

Lightheadedness strikes you for a second, suddenly everything around you is gigantic.... actually you shrunk.

Disorientated you looked around the room, the once small table looks like a tower now, a door that was once no bigger than your hand is over four times your size, and the bottle that you drank from is porportional to the size of an oil drum.

"Wha...What?" you stammered while frantically gazing around.

Even if you're the size of a large insect, at least you can now proceed outside this room.
1232221221121122211122212111122111111111.title: Investigate the door.

123222122112112221112221211112211111112.content:
Seifer approached, swaying toward you. "Hey there. You look new." He said, and winked at you, trying to turn on a charm that failed upon you.

"I'm not from around here. Why do you care?" You asked, not really caring why he cares...

"Well... I'm just curious, is all. I mean, I've never seen a girl sign up for struggle..." He chuckled, "I think it's kind of... cute." He lied.

You narrowed your eyes at him, "We'll just see how cute I am when I win the struggle tournament." You said in sarcasm.

He chuckled again. "Of course... But you know the chances are, you'll be losing to me." He said, his cocky voice again, that bugged you ever so. "Let's shorten this up... I'm going to win. Nothing to it. You'll lose, I'll win. I guarantee it..."

A scowl drew upon your face, "We'll just have to find out." You huffed, only inches away from his face.

You stepped onto the stage, and you awaited your opponent, Hayner...
123222122112112221112221211112211111112.title: Practice before you entering. You don't wan...

123222122112112221112221211112211112.content:
Well... you learned something from this experience. Not all nobodies appeared to be evil, this one seemed to be lost instead... about as lost as you are, literally and figuratively.

You lurched forward, not really caring about where you're going.

You can barely remember how life used to be like on destiny Island, nor can you remember that one year gap between then and now. All you know is that you used to be friends with Riku, Sora, and Kairi. You once accepted the darkness and it haunts you to this day... Speaking of which..

You could hear it in your subconscious, whispering to you, telling of it's amazing powers. But you ignore it.

Then you think of those 'other' friends, you wonder how Carey,Mark, and Justin are doing. You even wonder wether all of that was fake or not. Then you wonder what your supposed big brother Roxx is doing.

You snap out of your thoughts and look around
123222122112112221112221211112211112.title: past

choices: You receive the slice, knocking you out cold...
12322212211211222111222121111221112.content:
A long spear-like-scythe appeared in his left hand, and a short dagger in the other hand. He quickly charged toward you, and thrust his dagger at you, while swiping his scythe at your head. You ducked under the swipe in an instant, and deflected the dagger with your keyblade. You felt a flow of energy surge through your entire body, and immediately jumped backward, landing with a steady fighting stance.

"Oh, so you've done this before?" The nobody questioned, sarcastically... Even though everything the nobody uttered had the tone of sarcasm.

You took a deep breath, "No, never... But it sure felt like I've done this before!" You said, as you plunged your keyblade toward the nobody.

The nobody jumped up high, and landed behind you. "Is that all you got, kid?" He said, provoking you further. "By the way... Name's Xulan... Though I might as well tell you before you die." He swung his scythe downward on you, but you deflected the blow again with your keyblade.

"How am I doing that?" You whispered to yourself. The intense atmosphere of combat felt so natural to you, but you've never fought before, not even just a simple fist fight. "Back off!" You exclaim.

"Make me." He said, his eye narrowing upon you.

He thrust toward you this time, with more force, which shoved you back further. He tossed his dagger at you, and began to accelerate the same speed, only inches away from it. You swiftly dodged the dagger, and sprung forward, ready to strike. You successfully inherited the first strike, and were ready for another, but was knocked backward, by a heavy blow. Off guard, the nobody pushed you to the ground, and was ready to strike again...
12322212211211222111222121111221112.title: Attempts to attack you!

choices: Tell him what you saw, and what had happened.
Just forget anything ever happened, and continue to search for your friends.
12322212211212.content:
Justin suddenly morphed into Riku. "No... You haven't always been here... You used to be with me... Please Anna, try to remember me--"

Your vision went blank. You closed your eyes. You could hear a voice. The voice echoed upon many dreams, that perhaps were forgotten memories. You recognized the voice. It sounded like Riku with a mix of Justin... You couldn't decide whom was talking, but you knew you had to do something... Your memories were coming back, briefly... You could see someone, in the dark, blank vision you stood in. It was... That boy... Riku's best friend... You remembered his face, but had forgotten his name. The boy looked you in the eye, but said nothing. You opened your mouth, your mind filled with questions to be answered, but you uttered nothing. You stood there, only wondering upon your broken memories... Only wondering if they were forgotten... There were so many pieces missing to the puzzle.

"Anna!" A familiar voice called. "Anna, come back!"

You opened your eyes, regained your vision, and gazed at Justin. "Justin.. I...."
12322212211212.title: The Puzzle Pieces

choices: Turn back around, ignore him and run. There's no sense in talking to a stranger!
Ask him who he is, and what he wants. He may have answers about your vision...
1232221221122.content:
You open your eyes slowly, regaining your focus on Justin. "J-Justin?" You say, hesitating.

Justin cocks his head to the side, a worried look drew upon his face. "Are you alright?" He asked.

You shook your head in relief. "Y-yeah, I'm fine." You rub your eyes gently, and hop back to your feet. You begin to think about that strange vision, but doubt it was important. "Where'd the others go?" You asked Justin.

Justin rubbed his head, and looked at you embarrassed. "Well... They went off to seek emergency." He said in a low voice.

"WHAT?!" You scream in disbelief.

"Well, we thought it was pretty serious..." He said as his volume was becoming lower and his voice was getting deeper.

You rolled your eyes. "I said, I'm fine! Now we better go catch them before they do something stupid!"

You and Justin depart in the opposite directions, and dash toward the direction the others went. You felt like you were being followed... You snap your head behind you quickly, and realize there is a hooded man in a long, black coat watching you.

"...Anna... Come back to us..." The man said in a dark, icy voice.

You are startled by the man. All time has stopped. You turn around completely facing the man... You...
1232221221122.title: Mystery Man

choices: Let him get back up, this is his fight!
Help the boy to his feet, and help him defeat the creature.
1232222.content:
a small boy, who looked about 15. He had brown, spiked hair, which seemed as if it defied all laws of gravity. Who knows how much gel he put in that crazy spiked scalp, you thought. But then, your mind was set on something else. Underneath you was a glass floor, not like the solid concrete you stumbled on before. The glass was stained with five different people on it... One, had long silver hair, his bangs flowed infront of his face, almost covering his bright green eyes. One was a girl with red hair, which swept under her ears, and brought out her peaceful smile. One was a very Goofy looking dog; in fact, it looked like something you would see from a cartoon. One was a duck; again, looking as if it came from a cartoon, who knows why. And the one that you lied your very back on, was another boy with brown spiked hair... Exactly identical to the boy that stood before you.

The boy sprang to a high jump, and whipped out a strange key. The key was large and silver, you couldn't quite identify it from the distance you were at... You focused on the dis-figured creature that stood about 20 feet tall, engulfed in darkness. The young boy dived down graciously, stretching his key out in front of him like a sword, stabbing the shadow in the chest area. Soon, he landed on his feet, and immediately swept his feet from the ground again, thrusting his key forward, impaling it into the dark figure. But that wasn't enough to get rid of the monster... He only provoked it further.

You knew from the way it's blistering red eyes glared you down with a burning glance, that it wasn't focused on the boy... It was only concentrated on you! The dark creature inched closer to you, but the young boy fended it off with his powerful blows.

"Just hold on!" He called to you, still focused on defeating the creature. "I can take care of this!"

Suddenly, dark waves of shadow burst from the enemy, and sent the boy flying. The boy swiftly landed on his feet so gently, like there were clouds under him. The commotion wasn't done. The creature abruptly sent a dark, vast ball of shadow toward the boy, and it knocked him to his knees. The dark ball of shadow overwhelmed the boy. He released an agonizing scream of pain, I could tell the darkness was tormenting him. The boy fell backwards on his back. The shadows were too overwhelming; it was capitulating the boy!

Without warning, a ray of light beamed from your good hand, and the same key the boy weld appeared in your very palm.

A voice called out to you... You recognized that voice... That voice. The voice of your dreams! It was telling you to...
1232222.title: The Encounter

choices: Follow me... It is time for your adventure to begin!
Go home. You are not needed here.
12322221.content:
You sat helplessly from the ground. You were in too much excruciating pain to help him. What were you to do anyways? It's not everyday that you encounter a giant, black, shadow figure!

The boy soon staggered to his feet, wobbling, aimlessly strolling in all directions as the shadows were consuming him. He continued to scream in agonizing pain, and called for help. You sprung to your feet, and felt the urge to help him, even though you have never dealt with fights before. You attempted to step closer, but a strange, large eared, small figure appeared infront of you.

"Let him handle this." He said in a high pitched voice. "This is his battle."

You clenched your fists tightly, and gridded your teeth, "He's dying!" You screamed.

The little figure turned around, and revealed himself. You recognized that face! It was Mickey Mouse, from channel 57, the Disney network!

Your eyes widened, "Umm... You're Mickey Mouse... From the Disney Channel." You giggled.

Mickey scowled, " You will address me as 'Your Majesty'." He commanded in a stern voice. Though, it was hard to tolerate his attitude, due to his high pitched voice.

"Yes, your majesty." You guffawed.

"This is serious, you should not be laughing."

Mickey weld a key identical to the boy's; except the blade was gold, and the handle was silver. Mickey pointed his key toward the boy, and a beam of light emitted from it. It seemed to have helped the boy recover his stance.

The boy stomped his foot to the ground, and shouted "LIGHT!" The shadows that consumed him vanished in puffs of smoke! He steadied himself, wiped the blood from his mouth and charged at the creature, attaining combat again. He moved so fast, your eyes couldn't catch up with him! All you could do was watch in awe.

The boy came upon his last strike, and forced the tall dark figure to collapse, and vanished in a puff of dark smoke.

The boy began wheezing heavily. "Wooh... That was a tough one, your Majesty!" He said in confidence.

"How can anyone be so upbeat after that catastrophe?" You thought...

Mickey nodded, and a door appeared. He unlocked the door with his key. He turned to you, and said--
12322221.title: Let him get back up, this is his fight!

choices: You stop him before he leaves, and ask questions.
Let him leave, end the vision and return to reality in the mall.
12322222.content:
You struggled to your feet, and quickly dashed to the familiar boy. "Get up!" you yelped.

The boy had his energy drained, he couldn't even move his fingers. Then, suddenly he sprang to his feet, regained a sturdy stance and screamed: "LIGHT!" You covered your eyes from the immese light that gleamed from the boy. The light stopped, and so did the shadows that consumed him.

His clothes were no longer black... They were black and white! He rested his hand on your shoulder gently, and you felt a burst of energy survey from his hand through your body. You felt brave, and powerful. You bent your knees slightly, and were in a position for battle!

He gazed at you thoughtfully and said in a firm expression, "Let's end this." He glided toward the enemy, and sliced the creature with a powerful blow.

You bolted toward the creature so fast it was unreal. But you knew it was real. You knew this was happening. It felt so normal to you, like you have done this before. You sprang in the air so high, but you didn't question the amazing abilities that you had gained. You just continued to help the boy defeat the creature, with your powerful strikes.

The last strike was yours, and the shadowed figure collapsed, and crumbled into hundreds of pieces. The pieces vanished in a puff of black smoke, and you knew the tension was over. You had won this battle.

You gazed at the familiar boy deeply in his big blue eyes, and said, "Thank you, Sora."

Sora nodded, and turned around, ready to depart. "I'll see you again, Anna." He said, ready for take off.
12322222.title: The Last Stike

1233.content:
You slowly wake from the dream. You could remember it so clearly, and your hand still remembered to touch of the sword you took hold of. You sit up and look out at the ocean, yawning and rubbing the sleep from your eyes before laying back down, only to find yourself staring at someone you recognized.
"AH!" You cried. Bolting back up to a sitting position before turning around to face your friend. "Quit doing that! You know I hate that." You yelled in frustration, waving your arms at him to emphasis the point.
Only question is... Who is he?
1233.title: A nap on the beach

choices: Home... It's too late to do anything anyway...
See if you can find Sora or Kairi
12332.content:
Riku chuckled as you displayed your frustration. "Well, what would prefer? Another wake up call, or to sleep through the whole day?"
You paused, noting the time. You became flushed with embarrassment as you replied. "Of course I don't want to sleep all day... But that doesn't mean you have to do it like that!" You returned with anger.
"Oh, come on... How else am I supposed to tease you, Yuuki?" He grinned and poked you in the side. You flinched away from him and got up. "Maybe by not teasing me. How about that?" You retorted with a huff as you brushed the sand off you.
It hadn't been intentional, but Riku caught a bit of what you had under your skirt. He whistled, which caused you to look at him again, still frustrated and angry at his rude awakening. He still commented, though. "Cute... I suppose you like teddy bears, then?"
That was the last straw. You pulled out your wooden sword and lunged at him. He stepped to the side to avoid it, but you then made a two-handed swing right at his middle, which caught him in the stomach. Riku grunted and doubled over on his knees. "Wanna say anything else?" You asked, standing over him. After taking a bit to catch his breath, he replied. "I think-... I think I'm ok... I got enough." He managed to sputter out.
"Good." You put your sword away and walked off, much less frustrated than before.
Where do you go?
12332.title: Riku can be so mean sometimes...

choices: Riku won by a landslide... Not literally though...
123322.content:
You walked off, hoping to find Sora and maybe practice fighting again, though Kairi was always up for some fun games in the water.
It took a while, but you found them leaving the secret place under the tree. They went there together sometimes, and you occasionally teased one or both of them about it, but this time, you were simply curious.
After waiting for them to get a decent ways away, you ran up to the entrance and peered inside. It was a bit dark, but you steeled your nerves and pushed aside the branches to get in. If they could do it, then so could you!
Inside you found a winding tunnel that led to a clearing with a hole above that let in some sunlight. The tunnel had been bare, but the walls around the clearing were covered with drawings and doodles. You laughed at some of the things you saw, now understanding why they enjoyed so much time here.
Then you noticed the door... It was almost directly opposite the tunnel and was clearly wooden. However, there was no handle, no keyhole, and no window to see beyond it.
You knew it was a door by the shape of the yellow outline just around it, but that was it. You walked up to it and felt around, thinking there might be some hidden switch or something, but you couldn't feel anything. You knocked a couple times and could hear the faint echo on the other side, which meant it was definitely open space on the other side. However, with no means of opening it, you decided to leave it be.
You took another look around the cave and turned to leave. However, something made you turn back and look, and when you did, you saw an outline of a keyhole, but larger than any key you had ever seen. You looked at it in wonder, but it quickly faded moments later. You almost stayed to take another look, but decided against it, as you wanted to see if Sora or Kairi were still around.

Once outside again, you found Sora and Riku in another contest again, with Kairi acting as judge. It appeared to be another race. You jogged over to Kairi and tapped her on the shoulder. "So they're at it again?"
Kairi only looked over to see it was you before turning back to watch. "Yep... They were arguing about what to name the raft, I think... Or maybe who gets to be captain, not that it really matters."
"Yeah... I mean, it's not like we'll get too far. In fact, my guess is, we'll finally set out, go maybe two days, and then Sora will be whining about how bored he is or he and Riku will be fighting a lot, which means more work for us, so we won't really get anywhere. And that's if we manage to get out to sea at all."
"Actually, that's a good point... The oars won't be enough if we hit a bad current or something, not to mention a storm."
"Yeah..."
The two of you drifted off into silence, just as the boys came rushing back to the finish.
123322.title: Find Sora or Kairi, they're better company anyways

info.brief_description: Make your own story set in the kingdom hearts universe!
info.description:
You make your own story which is set in the Kh universe. It's pretty free what happens, except for what I say is not allowed

Rules:

Love is okay, but this time, I am outlawing sex

Stay in character

Unless the chapter is a choice chapter, no one lined chapters

Alignments are free to choose

Just because this is a KH story, it doesn't have to fit in with any of the games, it could just be in some alternate KH universe that there is no Sora, Kairi, Riku, Ansem (the wise), Xehanort, etc. (I'm not saying that you have to get rid of what's listed above, I'm just saying you don't have to have them).

Nobody main characters, Good, evil or neutral are allowed

Someone from a different storyline can meet someone from another storyline

The main character does not have to wield the keyblade

I may change this over time.
